intro: Atylus anemonifolia, commonly known as the meadow bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a yellowish throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, upright stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Atylus anemonifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
